abstract.p: Paola Gianturco-Toby Tuttle book on craftswomen around the world noted; photos (Currents: Los Angeles)'

block.p: After the World Conference on Women in Beijing in 1995, Paola Gianturco wanted to document the craftswomen of developing countries. Ms. Gianturco, a San Francisco-based marketing consultant, enlisted Toby Tuttle, a financial manager, to help photograph and write about women in 12 countries. They documented, among others, women painting in Zalipie, Poland, and doing needlework in Pang Mai Dang, Thailand; Ndebele women making beadwork in South Africa and Shipibo potters in Peru. Their book, ''In Her Hands: Craftswomen Changing the World'' (Monicelli, $60), will be in stores next month. ''My hope is that it will help make some invisible and, I think, heroic women more visible,'' Ms. Gianturco said.
